term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - fraction extracted, E
term.title: fraction extracted

item.text: The fraction of the total quantity of a substance extracted (usually by the solvent) under specified conditions, i.e. EA = QA.Q'A where QA is the mass of A extracted and QA' is the total mass of A present at the start.

notes.item: E may be expressed as a percentage, %E.
The term extractability is qualitative and should not be used as a synonym for fraction extracted.

If the aqueous phase is extracted with n successive portions of solvent, the phase volume ratio (solvent/feed) being r each time, the fraction extracted is given by: E n = 1- ( r D + 1 )- n If n = r = 1 and E1 = D/(1 + D) this expression is a concept of value in chromatography theory.
The fraction extracted is also known as the recovery factor, especially for a multistage process.

sources.item: PAC, 1993, 65, 2373. 'Nomenclature for liquid-liquid distribution (solvent extraction) (IUPAC Recommendations 1993)' on page 2384 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199365112373)

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
